subject: 25 Abbots Road - 10 Colt View
body:
Good morning Hannah,

I take it you still haven't had anything from Crest?

I would be grateful if you could impress upon them that if our mortgage
offer expires, they will have to do the work on 25 Abbots Road, and they
lose their non disclosure agreement.  It's therefore in their best
interests to start communicating with you.


Many thanks,
Paul

subject: Fwd: 25 Abbots Road - 10 Colt View
body:
Hi Hannah,

If you haven't sent that to them, it perhaps needs to be softened.  I've
spoken to Jade and this probably isn't going to help the situation.
They're the type of company that would cut their head off to spite their
entire body.

This situation is really becoming detrimental to my family and we need to
know what's happening. We're worried about the mortgage offer; we could
have been moved in already had they done their job properly.  Instead, they
have once again left the house to the last minute, and their quality checks
have been proven to be inadequate again.


Many thanks,
Paul

Good morning Hannah,

We need to exchange to be able to complete before Christmas.

If Crest is once again responsible for us losing a removal company, they
need to give us a much longer possession after completion as they'll have
forced us to move ourselves.  They could have exchanged yesterday, and the
money they promised would be transferred yesterday would have secured the
removals company.

We have to get our son settled in the new house before Christmas.

Paul

 SO32 1RE)
body:
Good morning Hannah,

We need to exchange to be able to complete before Christmas.

If Crest is once again responsible for us losing a removal company, they
need to give us a much longer possession after completion as they'll have
forced us to move ourselves.  They could have exchanged yesterday, and the
money they promised would be transferred yesterday would have secured the
removals company.

We have to get our son settled in the new house before Christmas.

Paul

subject:
Fwd: Purchase - Plot 34 Albany Wood (10 Colt View, Bishops Waltham
 SO32 1RE)
body:
Why are they doing this to us?

Please could I ask what you're aiming to do to get them to exchange?

For a seemingly valuable company, they don't seem smart enough to realise
that if we lose the mortgage, the likelihood of getting another is slim, as
they know I am an independent contractor, and we only just managed to get
this one, and we therefore can't move?  They lose the non-disclosure
agreement and have a house that they need to gut inside and out, and with
the nonsense they're pulling right now, I could create an entire film
length expose.

 SO32 1RE)
body:
Why are they doing this to us?

Please could I ask what you're aiming to do to get them to exchange?

For a seemingly valuable company, they don't seem smart enough to realise
that if we lose the mortgage, the likelihood of getting another is slim, as
they know I am an independent contractor, and we only just managed to get
this one, and we therefore can't move?  They lose the non-disclosure
agreement and have a house that they need to gut inside and out, and with
the nonsense they're pulling right now, I could create an entire film
length expose.

Good afternoon,

Please could I have an update on the visit on Sunday.  This is urgent.

Multiple items throughout the house were found, which were shown to Crest's representatives, including another issue with the DPC.

Our son has had another doctors appointment and is now suffering from anxiety and panic attacks.

The visit on Sunday was supposed to be exciting for him, yet dozens more issues were found, when the property was supposed to have been signed off by the build manager, as well as a stage 12 inspector.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road.

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.

To confirm the licence to occupy has been agreed for 3 days. Vacant possession will be required and all keys for 25 Abbots Road will need to be provided to our sales executive at Albany Wood by 12.30 on the 3rd day.

Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] URGENT: 10 Colt View

Further to the below I can confirm that all enquiries raised by your solicitors have been answered directly by or solicitors, and all relevant documentation available at this stage in the process, provided.

To confirm the licence to occupy has been agreed for 3 days. Vacant possession will be required and all keys for 25 Abbots Road will need to be provided to our sales executive at Albany Wood by 12.30 on the 3rd day.

As I advised in my email dated 5th December we are happy to agree (subject to contract) a completion date of 18th  December 2023, on the proviso that all items in the memorandum of agreement have been met.

As per point 4 of the memorandum of agreement, and in particular 4.2 which is required at exchange and point 4.3 which is require prior to completion.  Regarding 4.2, draft wording has been sent to your solicitor and we await confirmation that the proposed wording is agreed.   Please can you ask you solicitors to confirm agreement by return.

Regarding the meeting at plot 34 Albany Wood on Sunday 3rd December, this was for you to view the property only and was not a snagging visit. Had you wanted to carry out a snagging survey this would have needed to be done by prior appointment and undertaken by a RICS or other suitably qualified surveyor, as per the NHQB rules, and paid for by yourselves.

I am aware that our sales executive, Lynn Carrington, carried out a snagging report during that meeting, however this was not the intention of the visit and the report is for Crest use only and we do not intend to share with yourselves. The site team have already completed the majority of the items and most, if not all, will be completed prior to legal competition.

Subject: [EXTERNAL] URGENT: 10 Colt View

Good afternoon,

Please could I have an update on the visit on Sunday.  This is urgent.

Multiple items throughout the house were found, which were shown to Crest's representatives, including another issue with the DPC.

Our son has had another doctors appointment and is now suffering from anxiety and panic attacks.

The visit on Sunday was supposed to be exciting for him, yet dozens more issues were found, when the property was supposed to have been signed off by the build manager, as well as a stage 12 inspector.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road.

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.

Good Morning

Your solicitor has requested an exchange today with completion on 18th December.

As previously advised point 4 of the memorandum of agreement, and in particular 4.2 which is required at exchange and point 4.3 which is require prior to completion.  Regarding 4.2, draft wording has been sent to your solicitor and we await confirmation that the proposed wording is agreed.   Please can you ask you solicitors to confirm agreement by return.

This point is still outstanding, until we receive a copy of the letter signed by
yourselves we are unable to proceed to exchange.

I would also like to refer on the following three points prior to exchange of contracts.


  1.  Permission to erect a boundary fence has not been approved. We are currently reviewing your email sent this morning this shows only railings. Please could you also confirm that a Pickett fence is no longer required, as per previous emails from your solicitor ?



  1.  The cost of your allowance to redeem your redemption amount on your current mortgage cannot be confirmed until we are in receipt of an updated statement. This will be reflected on the completion statement.



  1.  Payment for your removals. Please provide your bank details by return. We will raise a faster payment BACs today. We are unable to pay the removal company direct as this invalidates your insurance for any damages.


Kind Regards



Natalie Haigh

The site team have already completed the majority of the items and most, if not all, will be completed prior to legal competition.

We cannot confirm, as you are requesting, that there will be no snagging items outstanding when you complete. However, any items that are not completed 24 hours before completion will be added to a schedule of Incomplete Works list that will be provided to yourselves prior to legal completion.


Kind Regards

Further to the below I can confirm that all enquiries raised by your solicitors have been answered directly by or solicitors, and all relevant documentation available at this stage in the process, provided.

To confirm the licence to occupy has been agreed for 3 days. Vacant possession will be required and all keys for 25 Abbots Road will need to be provided to our sales executive at Albany Wood by 12.30 on the 3rd day.

As I advised in my email dated 5th December we are happy to agree (subject to contract) a completion date of 18th  December 2023, on the proviso that all items in the memorandum of agreement have been met.

As per point 4 of the memorandum of agreement, and in particular 4.2 which is required at exchange and point 4.3 which is require prior to completion.  Regarding 4.2, draft wording has been sent to your solicitor and we await confirmation that the proposed wording is agreed.   Please can you ask you solicitors to confirm agreement by return.

Regarding the meeting at plot 34 Albany Wood on Sunday 3rd December, this was for you to view the property only and was not a snagging visit. Had you wanted to carry out a snagging survey this would have needed to be done by prior appointment and undertaken by a RICS or other suitably qualified surveyor, as per the NHQB rules, and paid for by yourselves.

I am aware that our sales executive, Lynn Carrington, carried out a snagging report during that meeting, however this was not the intention of the visit and the report is for Crest use only and we do not intend to share with yourselves. The site team have already completed the majority of the items and most, if not all, will be completed prior to legal competition.

Subject: [EXTERNAL] URGENT: 10 Colt View

Good afternoon,

Please could I have an update on the visit on Sunday.  This is urgent.

Multiple items throughout the house were found, which were shown to Crest's representatives, including another issue with the DPC.

Our son has had another doctors appointment and is now suffering from anxiety and panic attacks.

The visit on Sunday was supposed to be exciting for him, yet dozens more issues were found, when the property was supposed to have been signed off by the build manager, as well as a stage 12 inspector.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road.

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road.

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.

Good afternoon,

Please could I have an update on the visit on Sunday.  This is urgent.

Multiple items throughout the house were found, which were shown to Crest's representatives, including another issue with the DPC.

We need an urgent response regarding this, and to have all outstanding documents to be with our solicitor today.

Our son has had another doctors appointment and is now suffering from anxiety and panic attacks.

The visit on Sunday was supposed to be exciting for him, yet dozens more issues were found, when the property was supposed to have been signed off by the build manager, as well as a stage 12 inspector.

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.

Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road.


Mr Taylor

Further to the below I can confirm that all enquiries raised by your solicitors have been answered directly by or solicitors, and all relevant documentation available at this stage in the process, provided.

To confirm the licence to occupy has been agreed for 3 days. Vacant possession will be required and all keys for 25 Abbots Road will need to be provided to our sales executive at Albany Wood by 12.30 on the 3rd day.

As I advised in my email dated 5th December we are happy to agree (subject to contract) a completion date of 18th  December 2023, on the proviso that all items in the memorandum of agreement have been met.

As per point 4 of the memorandum of agreement, and in particular 4.2 which is required at exchange and point 4.3 which is require prior to completion.  Regarding 4.2, draft wording has been sent to your solicitor and we await confirmation that the proposed wording is agreed.   Please can you ask you solicitors to confirm agreement by return.

Regarding the meeting at plot 34 Albany Wood on Sunday 3rd December, this was for you to view the property only and was not a snagging visit. Had you wanted to carry out a snagging survey this would have needed to be done by prior appointment and undertaken by a RICS or other suitably qualified surveyor, as per the NHQB rules, and paid for by yourselves.

I am aware that our sales executive, Lynn Carrington, carried out a snagging report during that meeting, however this was not the intention of the visit and the report is for Crest use only and we do not intend to share with yourselves. The site team have already completed the majority of the items and most, if not all, will be completed prior to legal competition.

Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.

 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Further to the below I can confirm that all enquiries raised by your solicitors have been answered directly by or solicitors, and all relevant documentation available at this stage in the process, provided.   <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
To confirm the licence to occupy has been agreed for 3 days. Vacant possession will be required and all keys for 25 Abbots Road will need to be provided to our sales executive at Albany Wood by 12.30 on the 3rd day.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
As I advised in my email dated 5th December we are happy to agree (subject to contract) a completion date of 18th  December 2023, on the proviso that all items in the memorandum of agreement have been met.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

As per point 4 of the memorandum of agreement, and in particular 4.2 which is required at exchange and point 4.3 which is require prior to completion.  Regarding 4.2, draft wording has been sent to your solicitor and we await confirmation that the proposed wording is agreed.   Please can you ask you solicitors to confirm agreement by return.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Regarding the meeting at plot 34 Albany Wood on Sunday 3rd December, this was for you to view the property only and was not a snagging visit. Had you wanted to carry out a snagging survey this would have needed to be done by prior appointment and undertaken by a RICS or other suitably qualified surveyor, as per the NHQB rules, and paid for by yourselves.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
I am aware that our sales executive, Lynn Carrington, carried out a snagging report during that meeting, however this was not the intention of the visit and the report is for Crest use only and we do not intend to share with yourselves. The site team have already completed the majority of the items and most, if not all, will be completed prior to legal competition.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Please could I have an update on the visit on Sunday.  This is urgent. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Multiple items throughout the house were found, which were shown to Crest's representatives, including another issue with the DPC.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Our son has had another doctors appointment and is now suffering from anxiety and panic attacks. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
The visit on Sunday was supposed to be exciting for him, yet dozens more issues were found, when the property was supposed to have been signed off by the build manager, as well as a stage 12 inspector.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.

 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Further to the below I can confirm that all enquiries raised by your solicitors have been answered directly by or solicitors, and all relevant documentation available at this stage in the process, provided.   <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
To confirm the licence to occupy has been agreed for 3 days. Vacant possession will be required and all keys for 25 Abbots Road will need to be provided to our sales executive at Albany Wood by 12.30 on the 3rd day.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
As I advised in my email dated 5th December we are happy to agree (subject to contract) a completion date of 18th  December 2023, on the proviso that all items in the memorandum of agreement have been met.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

As per point 4 of the memorandum of agreement, and in particular 4.2 which is required at exchange and point 4.3 which is require prior to completion.  Regarding 4.2, draft wording has been sent to your solicitor and we await confirmation that the proposed wording is agreed.   Please can you ask you solicitors to confirm agreement by return.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Regarding the meeting at plot 34 Albany Wood on Sunday 3rd December, this was for you to view the property only and was not a snagging visit. Had you wanted to carry out a snagging survey this would have needed to be done by prior appointment and undertaken by a RICS or other suitably qualified surveyor, as per the NHQB rules, and paid for by yourselves.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
I am aware that our sales executive, Lynn Carrington, carried out a snagging report during that meeting, however this was not the intention of the visit and the report is for Crest use only and we do not intend to share with yourselves. The site team have already completed the majority of the items and most, if not all, will be completed prior to legal competition.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

To: Natalie Haigh <Natalie.Haigh@crestnicholson.com>; Serhan Handani <sh@bramsdonandchilds.com>; Hannah Rafferty <hr@bramsdonandchilds.com>; Adrian Sims <Adrian.Sims@crestnicholson.com>; Eileen Guihen <Eileen.Guihen@crestnicholson.com>; Peter Truscott <Peter.Truscott@crestnicholson.com>

Subject: [EXTERNAL] URGENT: 10 Colt View <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Good afternoon,<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Please could I have an update on the visit on Sunday.  This is urgent. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Multiple items throughout the house were found, which were shown to Crest's representatives, including another issue with the DPC.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Our son has had another doctors appointment and is now suffering from anxiety and panic attacks. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
The visit on Sunday was supposed to be exciting for him, yet dozens more issues were found, when the property was supposed to have been signed off by the build manager, as well as a stage 12 inspector.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

I need an urgent response, as we were told that the house would be ready by the end of October and we are fast approaching Christmas.<https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
Instead, history has repeated itself. Adrian Sims promised us that there would be no repeat of 25 Abbots Road. <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>
 <https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/south-and-yorkshire-team>

Good afternoon,

Trinity Rose's director was present in the calls with Adrian Sims because Trinity Rose would be engaged by Crest to carry out the checks on the works for 25 Abbots Road.

At no point were we advised that this time would be invoiced retrospectively, and has no bearing on the report for 10 Colt View. Our only involvement is that we are purchasing 10 Colt View. Crest engaged Trinity Rose to carry out the checks, to produce the original report of issues, and the second report to confirm if all items had been rectified.
